page.title: 01LAWRENCE WESTON'S LANDSCAPE
page.content: There is a large contrast in the landscape of our D Block. In the{west near the River Severn the landscape consists of{reclaimed flat land}about 50 metres above sea level. Much of this area has been used to build many new{industries}such as chemical and smelting works and a trading estate. Although there are a few{farms}such as Poplar Farm with fields of pasture crossed by rhines or drainage ditches, the land has never been of great use to farmers. To the{east}and{south}the land rises gently until it reaches about 100 metres at Kingsweston Ridge. This{higher land}has the post war council{housing estates}of Lawrence Weston and Shirehampton and the private housing of Coombe Dingle. In the middle of these housing areas are the{woods and parks}of the Blaise Castle Estate. St. Bede's School
